chunks.cleaned_english_translation: The idea that the Spirit is the giver of life is explained as follows. The Apostle says: The letter kills, but the Spirit gives life. First Corinthians chapter three. Also, in the Gospel: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh is of no benefit. John chapter six. In Ezekiel, it is commanded and said to the dry bones of the children of Israel, through the prophet: I will put my Spirit in you, and you will live. The Apostle also mentions: If the Spirit of Him who raised Jesus Christ from the dead lives in you, then He will give life to your mortal bodies through His Spirit living in you. Romans chapter eight, verse eleven. Therefore, mortal bodies are given life by the Holy Spirit.
chunks.original_latin:
Quia vivificator est Spiritus, sic docetur. Apostolus
dicit: Littera occidit, Spiritus autem vivificat (I Cor III). Item in Evangelio: Spiritus est qui vivificat,
caro autem non prodest quidquam (Joan VI). In Ezechiele
ad ossa arida filiorum Israel mandatur et dicitur,
per prophetam: Dabo Spiritum meum in vobis,
et vivetis. Item Apostolus dicit: Si autem Spiritus
ejus qui suscitavit Jesum Christum a mortuis
habitat in vobis, vivificabit et mortalia corpora vestra
per habitantem Spiritum ejus in vobis (Rom VIII 11). Ergo mortalia corpora vivificantur a Spiritu
sancto.
